reviews.title: Brilliant!
reviews.text: This hotel is amazing! We stayed here for 3 nights after a 12 hour flight from Hong Kong, and we stunk! The hotel upgraded our room as we were on honeymoon so we were upgraded to a harbour view room. the only reason we are giving this hotel a 4 star and not a 5 star is because its impossible to get any sleep at night as all you can hear is drunks and cars, and we were the the top of the building! great location, great restaurant & breakfast room, great servcie & a brilliant room which is done so nice.

We tried to find accomodation from away from the notorious noisy water front of Auckland viaduct basin, (cars race up and down on weekends and pub goers sound like they're not in love with each other after mid night) and finally chose these apartments which are set back in the city .
reviews.title: Egg cups and potatoe peeler not included ...

reviews.text: We stayed with 2 small children and wanted self catering with some style. It seems these apartments are badly in need of refurbishment, particularly the furniture and cabinets which were damaged and stains on the carpets and chairs. I wouldn't normally be bothered about this but at +$400 per night it's a bit strong.
reviews.title: Excellent, Can't Fault it

reviews.text: These comments apply to multiple rooms we stayed in as we had to be moved after the first week from rooms adjacent to the local night club district which was far too noisy to rooms overlooking the park at the back which were much quieter.
reviews.title: Quite Good

reviews.text: The bathrooms are nice and well maintained but unfortunately the double beds are really terrible with very soft and spongy mattresses which left me with back pain. After questioning the staff about getting a firmer bed we were provided with a "bed board" plank of wood to insert between base and mattress. Not really 5* solution for these prices !!
reviews.title: A great place to stay!
Perfect
reviews.text: If you're staying in Auckland, this is perfect. Rooms are clean and comfy. Hotel staff are helpful and attentive, without being too in-your-face. Valet parking is useful (as there's no easy parking close by), the bar is good, and there are loads of resturants within strolling distance.
I can't think of anything negative about it, and i'll certainly go back there again.
reviews.title: Consider nothing else
Awesome and worth every cent
reviews.text: If you stay in Auckland, and find anything wrong with this hotel, please go back on your medication.

It's a couple block away from downtown. The gardens are across the street. And our room/ suite had a washer/dryer, dishwasher, health club and pool. Full breakfast is included in your room rate. ( It as in ours anyway.)
reviews.title: Serviced appartments really
4 star and dirty bathrooms!
reviews.text: I suspicion there are floors that are resident owned apts. but it did't interfere with our life.

reviews.title: Very nice
reviews.text: Beautiful hotel, amazing rooms and location....the only reason I did not give it a 5* review is that the breakfast buffet reminded me of one you would find at a Holiday Inn....we were expecting more from such a nice hotel

reviews.title: Awesome!
reviews.text: I've stayed at a number of the 5 Star hotels in Auckland, including the Hilton and Hyatt, and this was by far the best. The enterance is an old courthouse and the rooms are in the adjoining tower. Our room was on the 19th floor, which wasn't classified as a harbour-view, but we still had fantastic views of the city & the harbour. Found the staff very friendly and the concierge/door person excellent - helped us with everything we needed.

reviews.title: Wedding Night/ Honeymooners- Definitely no special treatment will be given to you!
reviews.text: We booked to stay at the Metropolis Hotel on our Wedding night three months prior, we also booked three extra rooms for guests, for our wedding night.
My husband dropped off our bags at 11am the morning of our Wedding & told reception it was our Wedding night.
reviews.title: Top notch.
Excellent
reviews.text: When we arrived at 12:30am to check in, we the wedding couple were put on level 12 & the rest of our guests were put on level 16 & 17 with better views of Auckland city. We thought this was strange, but then we thought maybe they had up graded us to a suite. Well our room was small & was an in- ter connecting room. The room next door was having a party at 4am we had had enough of the noise so I rang reception someone did come to tell them to keep the noise down, but the party continued.

reviews.title: Simply the best
reviews.text: The next day when we checked out we complained but nothing was done. We also wrote a letter to Management about the service, room & problems we had on our Wedding night. The only compensation they have offered us is if we book & pay to stay at the Ascott Metropolis again they will give us a complimentary free up grade. Well with the poor service & room we received on our Wedding night we will definitely won’t be paying to stay at the Ascott Metropolis again & we recommend all other Wedding couples to book their Wedding night else where, where you are made to feel special.
